stories.text:
I'm a junior software developer looking to move into devOps and I'm wondering if anyone thinks that AWS Certifications are worth it. Specifically the 'Foundational' certificate, the AWS Certified Cloud Practitioner [1].

The sample questions [2] for the certification seem too easy for the certificate to be meaningful (you can get 100% by picking the name of the service that seems vaguely connected) but sometimes certifications are valued just to show that you're actually interested in an area.

[1] https://aws.amazon.com/certification/certified-cloud-practitioner/

[2] https://d1.awsstatic.com/training-and-certification/docs-cloud-practitioner/AWS-Certified-Cloud-Practitioner_Sample-Questions.pdf
stories.title: Ask HN: Are AWS Certifications worth it?

https://news.ycombinator.com/item?id=28706378

Hi all, A post of mine got “flagged”:

https://news.ycombinator.com/item?id=25541900

The string ‘[flagged]’ got added to the title.

The link is to a free tool which can be used by anyone to generate youtube name ideas, so not particular the reason for getting it flagged
stories.title: Ask HN: Can someone tell me why my post got flagged?
